Jim,

BRILLIANT - one picture is truly worth a thousand words, let alone five!  I
don't believe I have ever seen this in real life, so after 40 years collecting
blades and only occasionally finding tsuba I can now look out for tekkotsu
"seriously".  A couple of questions spring to mind:

- Is tekkotsu limited to a "time window"??  That is, is it only found in certain
iron tsuba (sukashi??) from say (hahaha) 1500 to 1620??  I guess most Edo iron
tsuba don't have tekkotsu.

- Is tekkotsu when found a "good" indicator???

Thanks for great pics.

Best regards,
Barry Thomas.

Ken,
I photographed some Kanayama tekkotsu and posted them here:

http://ph.groups.yahoo.com/group/nihontostudy/photos/browse/d4b0

Hopefully it will make things more rather than less clear.  It's difficult to
capture the whole package in a few photos.

JIm
